author: Contributed
title: Cybersecurity breach impacts platform P.E.I. school system uses
text:
Cybersecurity breach impacts platform P.E.I. school system uses
Article content
A recent cybersecurity breach by a platform P.E.I.’s education system uses may have impacted some people in the province.
A Jan. 9 new release from the Education Department said some personal information of students, parents, guardians, teachers and school administrators may have been part of a recent PowerSchool cybersecurity incident.
As a result of unauthorized access to PowerSchool, which is a third-party platform, personal data of past and present Island school members may have been compromised, the department said.
Personal information that may have been accessed includes people name, date of birth, address, phone number and other personal information such as food allergies.
The department said PowerSchool advised the P.E.I. government that it has contained the incident and implemented enhanced internal controls to secure its system.
PowerSchool’s platform is still operational across P.E.I.’s school system.
The province said it has been in direct communication with PowerSchool to better understand the scope of the incident and to identify who has been impacted in P.E.I.
Everyone who is identified as having been impacted will receive more information in the coming weeks, the department said.
A dedicated website will be set up on the provincial site with the latest public information.
The province said it is in ongoing discussions with PowerSchool about credit monitoring and identity protection services for eligible people who were impacted.
P.E.I.’s privacy commissioner has also been notified.
Anyone with questions or concerns regarding this incident can contact the Department of Education and Early Years by email at depteey@gov.pe.ca.
